benchmark_details.name: COFFE (Code Efficiency Benchmark for Code Generation)
benchmark_details.overview: COFFE is a benchmark for evaluating the time efficiency of function-level and file-level code solutions generated by LLMs, addressing the challenges of existing correctness benchmarks and proposing a novel test case generation method for time efficiency.
benchmark_details.data_type: coding problems with correctness and efficiency metrics

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate the evaluation of LLMs for time efficiency in code generation.

data.source: Constructed from existing correctness benchmarks: HumanEval, MBPP, CodeContests, and APPS.

methods: Stressful test case generation with contracts
Efficiency measurement using CPU instruction count
methodology.calculation: CPU instruction count is measured for efficiency evaluation, averaged over multiple runs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher efficient@k indicates better performance in generating correct and efficient code solutions.
methodology.validation: Test cases validated against existing correctness benchmarks.
